text: I have no idea what `meshscatter` is.

On the GLMakie side:
`scatter` essentially throws an image on relevant positions of a rectangle, if I understand correctly.
`meshscatter` takes one mesh and draws it at multiple positions
`mesh` takes one mesh and draws it at one position

`meshscatter` is essentially an optimization for doing many `mesh` calls with same mesh. Doing that instead would result in multiple instances of the same mesh on the gpu, if I understand correctly.
